history.content: I believe you can apply: "Applications are open to all those who hadn't previously applied to this program and been rejected."

children.subject: Yeah I think the wording is confusing; what they meant was both students who hadn't applied and students who applied but got rejected can apply, since there's no way you can be rejected without applying first.

Ah I see what you mean, thanks calc! That seems to contradict their email title though :/ It would be nice if staff could confirm.

Also, I did check back on my application portal and I don't see a way where I can submit a new application (I see no available applications to start). If rejected applicants are allowed to be reconsidered, is there a way to get around this?

@anon calc, I don't think this is the case. The link to apply is the original gradapp page, and there is no way to start a new app for those who have already applied. I believe the wording follows what the original anon said: "New Applicants Only". Please don't post in the student answer if you don't have the official answer!!!
<md>I think the wording is meaning what anon comp is saying.  This would make the title consistent with what the email body.</md>
Oh yeah my bad sorry, should've posted as a followup!!

I know this is late but I'm in the same situation as Anon Poet and Atom and am wondering whether either of you received an update on this matter. Also I'm wondering what the exact extension date is, as I did not seem to receive an email about this.

I emailed Michael directly, and they are not considering old applicants. As to why they decided this, they did not address that part of my question.

The extension date was May 29 so it would've been late anyway :/

Student response: OP had applied and got rejected, and is asking if these kinds of people can be reconsidered again.

Leaving this unresolved to hopefully get staff to see this for their response

history.content:
I'm reading the description of the extension, and it's only for those who have not applied and been rejected. Sorry, OP!

Heather

Hi advisors and instructors,

I just received an email this morning saying that the 5th year master program deadline has been extended and is open to new applicants only, due to the uncertainties within the job market caused by COVID-19. I want to first thank profusely to the faculty and staff at the department for caring us who are suffering from hiring freeze, etc. at this very difficult time. This very difficulty has affected many of us, including me myself. Even more, as an international student, I am scared by some rumors that the government is gonna cancel the OPT program(basically work authorization for international student).

However, I did apply early this year and unfortunately got rejected. I truly want to get into the program. In the past few months, I had made a good progress in my research and also have other things that I can update with the application. I am wondering if it is possible for me to apply to the program again?

Thank you so much in advance!
history.subject: EECS 5th yr master extension
